The following is a list of goalscorers in the [FIFA World Cup
finals](/wiki/List_of_FIFA_World_Cup_finals "List of FIFA World Cup finals").
Only goals scored during regulation or extra time are included. Any goals
scored during the [penalty shoot-out](/wiki/Penalty_shoot-
out_\(association_football\) "Penalty shoot-out \(association football\)") are
excluded. As of the [2018 final](/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_Final "2018 FIFA
World Cup Final"), sixty-two individuals have scored the total of seventy-
seven goals in the all of finals history. Ten players have scored [multiple
goals](/wiki/List_of_FIFA_World_Cup_finals_goalscorers#Players_with_most_goals_in_the_Finals
"List of FIFA World Cup finals goalscorers") in the finals, while half of
these players have done so in a single game. [Geoff Hurst](/wiki/Geoff_Hurst
"Geoff Hurst") is the only men's player to score a [hat trick](/wiki/Hat_trick
"Hat trick") in a final. Five players have done so via a [penalty
kick](/wiki/Penalty_kick "Penalty kick"). [Mario
Mandžukić](/wiki/Mario_Mand%C5%BEuki%C4%87 "Mario Mandžukić") was the first
player to score an [own goal](/wiki/Own_goal "Own goal") in a final, as well
as the first to follow it up with a goal at the opponent's net. He scored the
opening and closing goal of the final in 2018. Only two scorers,
[Pelé](/wiki/Pel%C3%A9 "Pelé") and [Kylian Mbappe](/wiki/Kylian_Mbappe "Kylian
Mbappe"), scored a finals goal as teenagers.[1]

[ESPN](/wiki/ESPN "ESPN") featured a documentary on the 34 finals goalscorers
who were alive before the [2010 final](/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup_Final "2010
FIFA World Cup Final").[2]
